intro: Disterigma empetrifolium, commonly known as the stonecress or rock cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. It typically grows in crevices and on rocky outcrops, adapting to harsh, dry environments. Its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils makes it a resilient and hardy species.
